page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF THE BLOCK
page.content: This block is a coastal, rural area containing most of one village,Mullion and a small number of residences scattered throughout the countryside. It is an area extremely popular with holidaymakers, particularly in the summer months, when high unemployment levels fall to some extent. The main attraction of the area is its magnificent coastal scenery and small sandy coves. Mixed farming is practised; cattle are reared for beef and for their milk, fodder crops are grown, as well as early potatoes. In most areas it is too exposed for flowers and vegetables. Mullion is the largest village on the Lizard peninsula and has the largest number of shops. Most of these depend in some way on tourism to support their income. The Comprehensive school for the area is just outside this block.
